title: Theme System - Light Mode Selection and Persistence
description: Verify that the user can select Light mode in the theme toggle, that the preference is applied immediately with smooth transition, saved locally, and persisted across page reloads.

steps.description: Navigate to the application home page with default or previously set theme.
Open the theme selection control in the header.
Select the Light mode option.
Confirm that the UI switches to Light theme with smooth visual transition.
Check that the Light theme setting is saved in local storage or equivalent persistent store.
Reload or revisit the application page.
Verify the Light mode is reapplied without user interaction.

title: Theme System - Dark Mode Selection and System Preference Override
description: Verify Dark mode can be selected manually, overriding system preferences, with persistence and smooth transition.

steps.description: Mock system color scheme as Light.
Load application with no stored theme preference.
Confirm the theme follows system preference (Light).
Select Dark mode from the theme toggle.
Confirm that the UI switches to Dark mode with smooth transition.
Reload application page.
Verify the manually selected Dark mode persists after reload.

title: Theme System - System Mode Selection with Dynamic System Preference Detection
description: Verify that selecting 'System' mode causes the theme to dynamically match system preference and updates on system color scheme changes.

steps.description: Select 'System' mode from the theme toggle.
Set system color scheme to Dark.
Confirm the application theme switches to Dark mode.
Change system color scheme from Dark to Light.
Verify the application theme updates to Light mode dynamically.
Reload page with system mode selected.
Confirm the theme on reload matches current system preference.

title: User Authentication - Email/Password Login Success
description: Verify successful login with valid email and password credentials and session persistence.

steps.description: Navigate to login page.
Enter valid registered email and correct password.
Click the login button.
Verify user is redirected to dashboard.
Confirm session is active and persists across page reloads.
Log out and verify session ends.

title: User Authentication - Email/Password Login Failure with Incorrect Credentials
description: Verify login fails and appropriate error is shown when incorrect email or password are provided.

steps.description: Navigate to login page.
Enter invalid or unregistered email and/or incorrect password.
Click the login button.
Confirm login is rejected.
Verify relevant error message is displayed to the user.

title: User Authentication - Google Social Login Success
description: Ensure user can authenticate successfully using Google social login and session persists.

steps.description: Navigate to login page.
Click on Google social login button.
Complete OAuth flow with valid Google account.
Verify redirection to dashboard upon successful authentication.
Confirm session persistence after page reload.

title: User Authentication - Protected Routes Access without Authentication
description: Verify that protected routes redirect unauthenticated users to login page.

steps.description: Attempt to navigate directly to a protected route (e.g., dashboard) without logging in.
Confirm the user is redirected to the login page.

title: Responsive Navigation - Client-side Routing with History Management
description: Verify navigation links load corresponding components dynamically, update browser history, and support back/forward navigation.

steps.description: Log in to reach dashboard.
Click on various navigation links.
Confirm components are lazy loaded and rendered appropriately.
Verify browser URL changes accordingly.
Use browser back and forward buttons.
Confirm navigation state and UI update match history navigation.

title: Responsive Navigation - Breadcrumb Support and Responsive Menus
description: Ensure breadcrumb trails display correctly matching navigation, and menus adapt responsively on different screen sizes.

steps.description: Navigate through nested pages or sections.
Verify breadcrumb accurately shows userâ€™s path.
Resize browser window to mobile dimensions.
Confirm menus adapt to a responsive mobile-friendly layout.

title: DynamicWrapper Component - Lazy Loading with Suspense and Error Boundary
description: Verify that components loaded via DynamicWrapper are lazy loaded properly with fallback UI shown during loading and error boundary catches load failures.

steps.description: Navigate to a page utilizing a dynamic component.
Confirm loading fallback UI is displayed while the component is loading.
Verify the component renders after load completes.
Force a failure in lazy loading (e.g. simulate missing component).
Confirm error boundary displays an error fallback UI gracefully.

title: Accessibility - Keyboard Navigation and Screen Reader Support
description: Verify all interactive components including navigation are accessible via keyboard and work correctly with screen readers.

steps.description: Navigate through the application using only keyboard tab, enter, and arrow keys.
Check focus order is logical and visible.
Confirm that screen readers announce elements correctly with meaningful labels.

title: Performance - Verify First Contentful Paint (FCP) under 1.5 seconds
description: Measure the time to first contentful paint on initial load and ensure it is under 1.5 seconds.

steps.description: Load the application on typical broadband network and modern device.
Measure and verify that FCP is recorded below 1.5 seconds.

title: Performance - Verify Time to Interactive (TTI) under 3 seconds
description: Assess time taken after load for the app to become fully interactive and confirm it is below 3 seconds.

steps.description: Load the application on a modern browser.
Measure TTI metric and verify it is under 3 seconds.

title: Performance - Bundle Size Verification Below 150KB gzipped
description: Inspect the production bundle size to confirm total gzipped JS size remains below 150KB.

steps.description: Build the application using production build command.
Analyze output bundle size and confirm it is below 150KB gzipped.

title: Cross-browser Compatibility - Functional in Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge, and Mobile Browsers
description: Verify core functionalities such as login, theme switching, navigation, and dynamic loading work consistently across supported browsers and devices.

steps.description: Open the application in latest versions of Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge on desktop.
Perform login, theme toggle, navigation, and dynamic component loading.
Confirm the UI renders correctly and all features function as expected on each.
Repeat test in iOS Safari and Android Chrome browsers on mobile devices.
Verify all key functionalities work without issues on mobile browsers.

title: Reusable UI Components - ThemeToggle Interaction and Feedback
description: Check that the ThemeToggle component correctly reflects current mode, allows switching modes with immediate visual feedback, and is keyboard accessible.

steps.description: Focus on ThemeToggle component.
Use keyboard or mouse to cycle through theme modes.
Confirm current theme mode updates accordingly and UI changes smoothly.
Ensure component is accessible via keyboard and has appropriate ARIA attributes.

title: Visual Regression - Verify No Unexpected UI Changes After Code Changes
description: Run visual regression tests on key pages and components to detect unintended UI deviations.

steps.description: Capture baseline screenshots of home, dashboard, login, and theme toggle in various states.
After application updates, re-capture screenshots.
Compare baselines and new screenshots to detect visual regressions.
